title: Lemon and Roast Garlic Speltotto

ingredients.content: 40 g Parmesan cheese, cut in pieces (2 cm)
150 g single cream, plus extra to taste
2 lemons, finely grated zest and 40 g  juice
fine sea salt, to taste,  plus extra for sprinkling
fresh flat-leaf parsley, roughly chopped, for garnishing

preparations.content: Slice the top off a whole garlic bulb to expose the tops of the cloves. Place on a piece of foil on a baking tray, drizzle with 1 Tbsp oil and sprinkle with a little salt. Wrap in the foil then bake for 1 hour (150°C). Meanwhile, continue with recipe.
Place Parmesan in mixing bowl and grate <b>10 sec/speed 10<b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Unwrap roasted garlic and set aside to cool for 15 minutes, then squeeze pulp out. Place in mixing bowl and blend <b>5 sec/speed 7<b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place shallots and remaining 1 Tbsp oil in mixing bowl then chop <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then sauté <b>5 min/100°C/speed <b>.
Add wine and 250 g chicken stock then, with simmering basket in place of measuring cup, reduce <b>10 min/110°C//speed <b>.
Add remaining 250 g chicken stock then, with simmering basket in place of measuring cup, cook <b>10 min/98°C//speed <b> or until spelt is cooked as desired.
Add ½ heaped Tbsp reserved garlic purée and 20 g reserved grated Parmesan then stir <b>15 sec//speed 1<b>.

Add lemon zest, lemon juice and chives then mix well with spatula. Season to taste and adjust consistency with more cream if desired. Serve sprinkled with remaining grated Parmesan and garnished with chopped parsley.

hintsAndTricks: Spelt is much more forgiving in this type of dish than risotto rice, as it won't overcook. Roasting the garlic to make a purée gives a nice depth of flavour to the end result.
